Ibid.Â'On the 11th November, at Strone-Nevis, near Fort-William, Evan Macmillan, aged one hundred years. This veteran , the oldest pensioner in Great Britain , entered the army in 1758 , and was severely wounded at the battle of Quebec under General Wolfe , in consequence of which he became an out-pensioner of Chelsea Hospital , and continued so for the period of seventy-five years . He retained all his faculties, except his eyesight, to the last.
